result.execSummary:
The defendant Sammy D Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and fees by 12-23-16, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sammy D Hunt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 125 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.  

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by December 23, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Defendant Sammy D Hunt in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Sammy D Hunt in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1 PENALTY ENHANCER:

On motion of the State, Court ordered PENALTY ENHANCER dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Sammy D Hunt not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Vega in court, defendant Sammy D Hunt not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. New defense counsel to be assigned. Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Eric M. Vega in court via-telephone, defendant Sammy D Hunt not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel Eric Vega is ill for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart, 6300 W Brown Deer Rd.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sammy D Hunt in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Sammy D Hunt in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
